roleset.name: make a loud noise

role.descr: source of loud noise, noise itself

roles.note: Noise and explosion are often integrally linked-- use this sense when the noise is particularly being refered to-- otherwise, use blast.03 (from blast.01-n)

example.name: both args
example.text: John blasted his stereo.

example.name: both args
example.text: his blast of the trumpet
The trumpet's blast
blast of silence

roleset.note:
BLAST-V NOTES: Frames file for 'blast' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entry 45.4, Framenet entries Perception noise and Judgment (that's two classes). (from blast.01-v predicate notes)
BLAST-N NOTES: Updated by Julia. Member of Vncls 43.2 (from blast.01-n)

roleset.name: assign blame harshly

example.name: all args
example.text: Kemper also blasted the Big Board for ignoring the interests of individual and institutional holders.
example.arg: for ignoring the interests of individual and institutional holders

example.name: unstated reason
example.text: Considering how tenuous the security of that runway is anyway, the better option -- both morally and strategically -- would be forthe Bush administration to blast the regime publicly, in termsclear enough for all influential Somalis to understand.
example.arg: in terms clear enough for all influential Somalis to understand

example.name: args 0 and 1
example.text: Anderson couldn't have been more wrong in his blast of the Browns fans in an e-mail to Browns beat writer Jeff Schudel.
example.arg: in an e-mail to Browns beat writer Jeff Schudel.

example.name: all args
example.text: his blast of the DOT for pulling a guy over and doing a roadside inspection
example.arg: for pulling a guy over and doing a roadside inspection

roleset.note:
BLAST-V NOTES: Frames file for 'blast' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entry 45.4, Framenet entries Perception noise andJudgment (that's two classes). (from blast.02-v predicate notes)
BLAST-N NOTES: (from blast.02-n)

roleset.name: mode of motion

example.name: 3-2-1-blastoff!
example.text: The space shuttle Atlantis blasted into orbit from Cape Canaveral, Fla., and its crew of five astronauts launched thenuclear-powered Galileo space probe on a flight to the planetJupiter.

roleset.note: BLAST-V NOTES: Frames file for 'blast' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entry 45.4, Framenet entries Perception noise andJudgment (that's two classes). (from blast.04-v predicate notes)

roleset.name: attack, usually with explosives, explosion (focus on physics/motion, not sound)

roles.note: Differs from PB in the inclusion of arg2-- it seemed appropriate to separate the explosive device from the target, asboth can occur at once. (this wouldn't be a bad addition to the PBframe, either) (from blast.03-n)

example.name: blast-v: boom
example.text: In October, two suicide bombers blasted a huge hole in the side of 'Cole' as it sat in the port of Aden.
example.arg: a huge hole in the side of 'Cole'
as it sat in the port of Aden

example.name: blast-v: boom
example.text: Two months after a bomb blasted its hull, the USS Cole is back in the US.

example.name: blast-n: with arg1
example.text: a blast of flame

example.name: blast-n: with arg2
example.text: the Kenya embassy blast

example.name: blast-n: with args 1&2
example.text: the Nairobi US embassy bomb blast

example.name: blast-n: with args 0&1
example.text: his blast of the enemy bomb

example.name: blast-n: with direction, semi-metaphorical explosive motion
example.text: His blast of a shot from 25 yards away

example.name: blast-n: more metaphorical blasting
example.text: the blast of a huge epidemic

roleset.note:
BLAST-V NOTES: Frame by Perryn (from blast.05-v)
BLAST-N NOTES: Added by Julia basedon PB blast.05. (from blast.03-n)

roleset.name: Have a good time

example.name: This was about a baby liking the boxes more than his Christmas presents
example.text: But he had a total blast with the boxes.

roleset.note: Based on google data. No comparison. No VN or FN classes. Framed by Katie.

example.name: ghostbusters
example.text: But they don't careen around in an old Cadillac, wear funny suits or blast away at slimy spirits.

example.name: take off
example.text: The unmanned rocket blasted off this morning from Kazakhstan.
